TextBody:
Hi Joseph,

The only relation between the low disk space banner and the devices menu is that if you have low disk space, some pages might load slower.
If you approve, I can ask for access to your back end and see what is taking up the disk space and remove some old patch files and older backup files that are not needed anymore.
As for the vulnerability patch, please send me your questions, and if I do not have the answer I will forward them to our engineering and get the answers.

Thank you,
Eduard Nut
Technical Support Engineer

Endpoint Protector now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
CoSoSys Ltd
www.endpointprotector.com

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000Caz9O:ref

Eduard,

Here are the items I would like to discuss:


  *   When you click on Device Control>>Devices the status just keeps spinning and nothing populates. If you let it spin long enough it starts to fill up the drive. We would like to be able to use this functionality.
  *   The security advisory appears to suggest that we upgrade to version 5.9.3.0. We are currently running 5.8.1.0. Can you give us guidance on how to update our environment? Is it as simple as clicking the 'Check Now' button and applying any updates?

Joseph Valle
713-486-6593

TextBody:
Hi Joseph,

The disk space does not fill up when you just check the devices, but if there are a lot of them, you might see a long loading time. For this, I would like to check the number of devices in the database from the backend. To that end, can you allow me to ask for access from our server team and SSH into the server to check this?

As for the upgrade process, it is just as simple as clicking the check now, selecting the upgrade available, and then pressing apply updates. But as per the last notification from Netwrix, the vulnerability patch has been taken down for now as engineering has to apply another fix to it.

Let me know if you have other questions.

Thank you,
Eduard Nut
Technical Support Engineer

It does appear that the disk space does actually fill up when we click 'Devices'. If we go to the Server Information section we can see that the system drive is at 28% capacity, but after we click 'Devices' and wait for a while it then goes up to 78% capacity.

TextBody:
Hi Joseph,

After checking the server, the disk space looks great.
However, I noticed that there are a large number of devices, more specifically, duplicates created by the EPP server.
This might be the reason you cannot access the devices page. To solve this, we need to upgrade to 5.9.3.0 since it contains a fix for the device duplication issue, and after I can delete the duplicates from the server.
To best solve it, can you tell me if you are using any custom rights on any device?

Eduard Nut
Technical Support Engineer

DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
CoSoSys Ltd
